root.publications: Green, Ian. 2003. The Genetic Status of Murrinh-patha. In Nicholas Evans (ed.), The Non-Pama-Nyungan Languages of Northern Australia: Comparative Studies of the Continent's Most Linguistically Complex Region, 125-158. Canberra: Pacific Linguistics. ISBN 085883538
root.pub-comments: "Despite this array of dissimilarities, however, it is now clear that Mp [Murrinh-patha], far from being an isolate, is in fact closely related to its eastern neighbour Ngty [Ngan'gityemeri]; indeed I propose that the two language together make up the 'Southern Daly' subgroup" (Green 2003: 128).

child.publications: Green, Ian. 2003. The Genetic Status of Murrinh-patha. In Nicholas Evans (ed.), The Non-Pama-Nyungan Languages of Northern Australia: Comparative Studies of the Continent's Most Linguistically Complex Region, 125-158. Canberra: Pacific Linguistics. ISBN 085883538
child.pub-comments: "Walsh (1976: 4) identifies three dialects of Mp [Murrinh-patha]: Murrinh-kura, Murrinh-rdiminin, and Murrinh-patha itself. Data presented here comes exclusively from the Murrinh-patha dialect; all three dialects are close, and there is no suggestion that they diverge grammatically in any significant way" (Green 2003: 130).

child.publications: Green, Ian. 2003. The Genetic Status of Murrinh-patha. In Nicholas Evans (ed.), The Non-Pama-Nyungan Languages of Northern Australia: Comparative Studies of the Continent's Most Linguistically Complex Region, 125-158. Canberra: Pacific Linguistics. ISBN 085883538
child.pub-comments: "Walsh (1976: 4) identifies three dialects of Mp [Murrinh-patha]: Murrinh-kura, Murrinh-rdiminin, and Murrinh-patha itself. Data presented here comes exclusively from the Murrinh-patha dialect; all three dialects are close, and there is no suggestion that they diverge grammatically in any significant way" (Green 2003: 130).

Data presented here comes exclusively from the Murrinh-patha dialect; all three dialects are close, and there is no suggestion that they diverge grammatically in any significant way" (Green 2003: 130).

child.publications: Green, Ian. 2003. The Genetic Status of Murrinh-patha. In Nicholas Evans (ed.), The Non-Pama-Nyungan Languages of Northern Australia: Comparative Studies of the Continent's Most Linguistically Complex Region, 125-158. Canberra: Pacific Linguistics. ISBN 085883538
child.pub-comments: "Walsh (1976: 4) identifies three dialects of Mp [Murrinh-patha]: Murrinh-kura, Murrinh-rdiminin, and Murrinh-patha itself. Data presented here comes exclusively from the Murrinh-patha dialect; all three dialects are close, and there is no suggestion that they diverge grammatically in any significant way" (Green 2003: 130).

child.publications: Green, Ian. 2003. The Genetic Status of Murrinh-patha. In Nicholas Evans (ed.), The Non-Pama-Nyungan Languages of Northern Australia: Comparative Studies of the Continent's Most Linguistically Complex Region, 125-158. Canberra: Pacific Linguistics. ISBN 085883538
child.pub-comments: "A detailed reassessment of the genetic status of the two southern Daly languages has become possible only in recent years, with the availability of Reid's (1990) doctorate on Ngty [Ngam'gityemeri], which contains a full account of the verbal morphology for both extant dialects, Ngw [Ngan'giwumirri] and Ngan'gikurunggurr (Ngk)" (Green 2003: 130).

child.publications: Green, Ian. 2003. The Genetic Status of Murrinh-patha. In Nicholas Evans (ed.), The Non-Pama-Nyungan Languages of Northern Australia: Comparative Studies of the Continent's Most Linguistically Complex Region, 125-158. Canberra: Pacific Linguistics. ISBN 085883538
child.pub-comments: "A detailed reassessment of the genetic status of the two southern Daly languages has become possible only in recent years, with the availability of Reid's (1990) doctorate on Ngty [Ngam'gityemeri], which contains a full account of the verbal morphology for both extant dialects, Ngw [Ngan'giwumirri] and Ngan'gikurunggurr (Ngk)" (Green 2003: 130).
